website_summaries.verdict: Travel doesn't have to require packing multiple accessories in order to power up: this clever travel router also provides a mobile charger for your smartphone.
pros: Battery lasts for several hours, or plug into electrical outlet to power without battery
Will charge any devices that use a 5V USB charger, including tablets and laptops
Will allow access to WiFi for several devices at a time
Fits unobtrusively in pocket or purse
cons: Can run a bit slow in some places, especially hotels
Initial set-up is a little confusing, as printed directions aren't too clear

customer_reviews.title: ... is my third power bank and I couldn’t be happier with it
customer_reviews.text: This is my third power bank and I couldn’t be happier with it. I tried the router feature last week when I was traveling in Japan and it worked, although slightly slow. This device is really handy when traveling because it fits conveniently in your pocket while charging your phone. I used it a couple of times while walking around due to its small size, it didn’t bother me much. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Luong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device. Super handy.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Hotel life saver. Have tried all features love it. Cant stand hotel WiFi. Plug this in to ethernet set it up and Bam better WiFi just for me. Back up batter is a nice touch and device is a nice size. Interface is not difficult to use and was easy to set up. Background in pc repair.
customer_reviews.author: Hisui

customer_reviews.title: we had 2 smart phones, a tablet and laptop that all connected ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this in Mexico at a hotel that charges $60/device/week for WiFi. The HooToo Wireless Travel Router counted as one device on the hotels WiFi, then all the other devices we had connected to the HooToo router, we had 2 smart phones, a tablet and laptop that all connected quickly and without any problems to the HooToo router. Highly recommended for this purpose, especially for around $40! Battery is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brent S.

customer_reviews.title: Slow ... when it works
customer_reviews.text: While this product seems good on paper, in practice it's not very functional. When in wireless bridge mode, the router loses connection so often you can't really use it. You can reboot the router and that will fix it for another 15 - 30 minutes, but it's just not reliable. Also, the speeds are a serious issue. If you can get the router to connect and stay connected your speeds will never exceed 2 - 3 mbit. If you looking for a travel router look elsewhere. If you rate this product poorly, they will try to buy your bad review off Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeavis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. "Connection Failed" again and again.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the HooToo Tripmate to share a WiFi network on a cruise ship. Unfortunately it doesn't actually work for that purposes. Where all of our other devices connected effortlessly, the Tripmate just endlessly tells me "Connection Failed" when I try to connect to the WiFi network on the ship. Never even made it to the login screen. Tried it at a hotel; nothing. Same error. Do not buy the HooToo Tripmate if you're looking to bridge wireless connections! And since I bought this more than four weeks before the trip, I can't even return it, so now it's just going in my drawer of useless garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for trips, the battery is useful daily.
customer_reviews.text: Item works well. It's very sturdy feeling - a bit heavier than I initially expected, but nice and solid. It comes with a charge cable, and useful to keep your phone topped up when on the road between charges. I like the handy battery indicator and the flaps that cover the ports from water and dust. I don't know if it's submerge able (I wouldnt) but it'll keep pocket, purse, and backpack lint from gumming up the ports. WiFi features are a plus, but the 10k battery comes in handy daily. It's not gathering dust between hotel stays.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool product, especially if you travel and stay in hotels. Most hotels have some sort of protection on their network (and often charge a fee). Also, you usually can't use an Amazon Alexa or Google Chromecast device on their systems because there's no way to enter the password info. This device gets connected to the hotel, then you connect to it via your smartphone or PC, then it becomes your portable hotspot. Connect up to several devices at the same time. Works great! (BTW, it even supports an Ethernet cable connection if the hotel has one). I also use the "spare battery" function a lot.
customer_reviews.author: GJJ

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true.
customer_reviews.text: If this thing actually worked well it would be the best thing since sliced bread. I went with this mainly because of the built in battery. There is no electricity at some hotel pools and boat docks as well. Upon setting this up at home next to my home router I soon realized how bad this thing is. Just tethering off my main home router with it sitting right next to it it was getting around 1mps. I walked into the next room and had hardly any signal. If it's this bad in my home I can't imagine how miserable it will make us on vacation. Sorry but returning.
customer_reviews.author: D. Purciel

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi bridge
customer_reviews.text: I first used a HooToo product some years ago to help with WiFi usage restrictions on a cruise ship. It is still performing perfectly, and I purchased this new TM05 Titan as a backup/successor if my TM01 does die. Setup was easy, documentation simple and the 05 connected to my home network. I’ve used the 01 to stream tv and it’s quite capable. A very good device in my applications
customer_reviews.author: Tim0808

customer_reviews.title: A great router and battery! Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This portable router is excellent for adding devices to a hotspot! It is also fantastic for extending WiFi service. I place it in a area with good reception and it provides much better WiFi coverage. An added benefit with a family is they all connect to this router. You only need to attach the router to WiFi. I did have a problem with the power connector. Customer Service was excellent at resolving the problem! I couldn’t ask for better service!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The device is a great little tool to have on vacations or when on the road, however the instructions included with the device are useless. In the diagrams showing the hook up of the Network Cable it shows it going into the USB slot which is impossible to do. Network cables have an RJ145 on the ends not a USB,I have sent an email to Tech Support informing them of this issue. I downloaded the owners Guide from their website and its a little better than what came with the device. Would have gave it Five Stars but for the crappy instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred J. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great option for travelers. The answer to public WiFi identity theft
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently. I was looking for a safe method of using public WiFi such as a hotel. I have had two separate occasions where my credit card and banking information have been compromised. I needed a layer of security that would protect my identity and information. I needed it easy to set up. This router is perfect. It serves my purpose very well. I would highly recommend to anyone who uses public WiFi and wants the added security. You connect it to public WiFi, you go through a sequence of steps to connect to the “secure” wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Dedrickson

customer_reviews.title: Works well, needs USB-C
customer_reviews.text: My second portable WiFi device. The previous one (RavPower) was so awful, I threw it in the garbage. This one works fine. No issues so far, but I haven't tested everything yet. I took off one star because of Micro-USB. This is from like 10 years ago. New standard is USB-C, and the only reason I bought the RavPower first, instead of this one is because I am trying to eliminate Micro-USB fromy life. How many different cables do we need? Time to improve the USB, HooToo.
customer_reviews.author: Critic

customer_reviews.title: Trust the Reciews
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for whatever he uses it for... it worked maybe a full five minutes, then stopped. He called tech support, but was unable to get anywhere with them. All I’ve heard was him complain about how he should’ve trusted the reviews, but didn’t. Unless you want a grumpy husband, I would strongly advise against purchasing this item. We sent it back and received a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great for captive portals
customer_reviews.text: I often stay in a hotel for work, and with all of the devices I carry, connecting them to the hotel’s captive WiFi portals can be challenging, or sometimes impossible. This router solves all of those problems. I turn on the router, connect through one device that can access the captive portal, and the router will send all the devices through the one connection. The WiFi can be a bit slow when connecting to a hotel’s WiFi, I recommend connecting to an in-room Ethernet jack when you can. I have connected an external hard drive to access files, and while it works, it can be a little unreliable. I highly recommend for internet only.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ipads and phones, and passing pdfs to apple ipad. I jump on all the Open Wifi hotspots.
customer_reviews.text: This device has been working great for me since I got it, one minor glitch when I first set it up I started to transfer batches of pdfs which was about 100-300meg folders (to my apple Ipad 2018), I would get disconnected. Called Tech support they walked me the basic setup again and then they had me test it with the pdf's folder which was about 270megs at the same time I streamed youtube video of 1080p to the same Ipad as I was downloading and it worked fine. The wait time fro customer service was maybe 5min and they were quick with their answers.
customer_reviews.author: HectorH

customer_reviews.title: My NEW travel partner!
customer_reviews.text: Had a little trouble configuring the device and like magic I got an email from the manufacturer! Followed the instructions given to me (update firmware) and tested it at home it worked like a charm. Took it on a cruise ship and more issues. I emailed the manufacturer and got a couple tips. The tips didn’t work because the cruise line had made changes to its wireless settings. After tinkering around I got it to work and emailed the manufacturer the steps. Now i’m writing this review from a cruise ship via my “NEW travel Partner” my hootoo!! 😝 Don’t leave home without it!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a long road trip so the kids could watch shows/movies on an old iPad, which we mounted between the two front seats. Worked great, never a problem with battery life. Note, there is a new firmware version which was recommended to install on one of the blogs I read. I'm not sure if it was really necessary, and it was kind of hard to upgrade the firmware since the instructions on the website didn't really match the thing you download, but I got it to work eventually. Google 'codinghorror tripmate' for a very helpful blog post on how to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Dueck

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 12 months of infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: Update: Internal battery only lasted a year; now, it won’t take a charge. Dropping to two stars because I barely used it (maybe two or theee days a month). Disposable electronics like this one create a lot of unnecessary waste. I was skeptical, but it actually works. I’m using it to create a wireless network to link a few cameras. My needs are simple, no internet or anything, but it works and the battery lasts all day in my scenario.
customer_reviews.author: B. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for Traveling!
customer_reviews.text: Worked as planned! Took this onna cruise and was able to pay for one Wifi access and share it between 3 phones! The best thing about this is the built in battery. Having the ability to take this around the ship and not have it plugged in was AWESOME. This is definitely a must have when traveling. Especially with lots of hotels offer free wired internet in the rooms but you have to pay for wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: A little tough to set up and get up and running. I consider myself fairly high-tech savvy, having built three home computers. But this little thing took me about two hours to set up, and I had to call tech support. That was something that I didn't expect. So the instructions could be a bit more clear, even after getting an email from the company spelling out the steps again. But now that I have it linked, it appears to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not for Holland America
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased specifically so my husband and I could share the wifi package we purchased on board a Holland America line cruise. Unfortunately, they do not give you a password but rather, force you to sign-on through their proprietary website while on board. It worked well in my home prior to leaving for the cruise but was totally useless in regard to that for which it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Mantiposa

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life. A little slow and occasionally needs re configuring.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life and good wifi range. Occasionally though, It will forget settings to connect to my phones tethering and I have to go into settings, re scan and re enter password to connect. Then it will reconnect fine a few times then forget again. Mostly used to allow access to a 4TB hard drive from several devices. Longest time I run it was about 12 hours. Still had battery left after that. Great for long flights and roadtrips.
customer_reviews.author: mr s w cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: NO ADVERTISED ANDROID APP AVILABLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little device to use as a wifi bridge while traveling as my VISION wireless service only allows access for one device to be connected at a time. I tried to download the HOO TOO Android app to set it up per the instructions. THERE IS NO ANDROID APP!!! If I can't activate this device and use it,it is worthless to me!!!! Now I'm stuck with a worthless piece of crap and customer service thru "web address" is non existent because the website is only a "sales" page with no instructions available!!!
customer_reviews.author: susan jones

customer_reviews.title: Dont expect fast speeds. Very slow but does work as a router/bridge.
customer_reviews.text: It works but very slow. The first unit kept disconnecting from Wifi and the second seems to stay connected. My home internet gets 100Mbps down and 100 up. This thing only sees 5Mbps down and 10 up. Thats pretty awful if you ask me. I suppose it "works" but I dont consider this a win nor usable for 5 devices.
customer_reviews.author: A. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Rather unstable; drops and reboots periodically to the point its unusable
customer_reviews.text: So it’s pretty unstable and unreliable when you try to share a WiFi connection. It seems like at times it drops off the WAN side network and when it does it seems to reboot. It seems to be better when you’re sharing an Ethernet connection. But, yeah, it is pretty marginal when it comes to sharing an 802.11b/g/n network.
customer_reviews.author: Allen G.

customer_reviews.title: NOTE: 2.4G access only, so if your hotel has old slow access you are good.
customer_reviews.text: if your hotel has 2.4G access then this works fine, however having spent the last 2 months traveling through US, Canada and the UK, a vast majority of the hotels I was in were 5G access only and this unit does NOT support 5G WiFi, not really the fault of the unit, I didn't even think to check or that to be an issue. but is should be clearer in the marketing that it only works on 2.4G Wifi and not 5G. if I could return it I would, but I threw away the box before leaving. I gave it to my daughter to use a phone charger works great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tekdave

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, but sometimes has issues staying connected.
customer_reviews.text: It works okay, but it has trouble connecting to hotel wifi or anything with a login screen. It takes longer to connect and stay connected than the older, black one that I had before. Not worth the price point I don't think.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. This does work as a travel router and the size is compact, however 2 things make it useless: 1. It's not made to run while plugged in 2. It reduces your internet speed to an unusable level. It took about 5 minutes for the search page on google to show up. When I bypassed the router, the speed was fine. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Works well on cruises!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well extending our single-user network on a recent cruise. Only negative is that it would "forget" the network and have to be re-booted almost daily (mainly towards the end of the cruise). Very easy to set up and secure. I was able to leave it connected to my computer's USB port while on the network without any issues. Small, but heavy. Would be perfect if there was a way to secure the USB charging cable to the router when not in use...
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Gay

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT on hotel wifi
customer_reviews.text: I literally just got this delivered a few hours ago and I LOVE IT. I'm staying in a hotel for an extended time for work, and often times hotel wifi requires you to login via the browser. This causes issues for things like Chromecast, and cameras(I have a camera to watch my dog). The setup was easy, and now I am able to use both my Chromecast and my doggie camera!
customer_reviews.author: Joselyn

customer_reviews.title: The setup does not work
customer_reviews.text: If you want a nice extra battery--this is the product for you--other than that it is impossible to set up to work as advertised. I have struggled to set this device up since I bought it just over 5 months ago and I still can't get it to follow the instructions sent to me--not only with the product on paper, but also later sent to me by email. The device does not follow the guidance given in the instructions, either as written, or on the app. If you want to be frustrated, buy this beautiful piece of engineering that ends up in the electronic recycle pile and drink yourself silly. Waste your money somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great features and just the right size for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Great features and just the right size for traveling. The feature I liked the most is that I can use it as a battery backup for my cell phone. I was able to fully charge my Samsung S6 three times to full and the router's battery still had charge. Good range and it worked with my Chromecast at the hotel. Also the video streaming feature that allowed me to stream movies to the TV from my laptop through the Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: raul pena

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: With so many people complaining about this thing, I was a little fearful about buying, but it's great. So may people complaining about speed, but I'm getting a steady 44-45 MBps from my iPhone XR for internet speed. The only thing I'd wish for would be faster speed accessing my USB drive plugged into the device 4-5 MBps, but I could hardly expect any more from this or any other device for under a hundred dollars or so. Set up was simple and straight forward. While I am in IT for a living, my wife's cat could have set this thing up. Love the nice strong battery to power a hard drive using with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Potter

customer_reviews.title: Shipped open box item as new... And it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Well, they shipped me an open box item, that had a different IP address and admin username and password than the factory settings. So uhh.. can't speak to how good this thing is, but the product should have never been shipped to start with since it wasn't even new. 0/5.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: I also took this with me on a trip to Peru as a power bank and it worked perfectly fine. It is made of solid quality material and ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I had a little bit of trouble understanding how to use the internet on this device but after a few minutes I was able to figure it out. The instructions are very detailed and straight forward. I also took this with me on a trip to Peru as a power bank and it worked perfectly fine. It is made of solid quality material and very durable. Just to be clear for those who are still wondering, it does not work like a hot spot!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy H

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Own 2 of these - love love love it! When I travel ( often) this little gizmo is my constant companion. I use it to watch movies off flash drive on my iPad. Works fantastically with nPlayer Pro app - any format I throw on the drive work like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: VKornet

customer_reviews.title: Could not get secure WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up a hotel LAN cable and used it as a WIFI router according to instructions. Even though I had a password enabled SSID, the connection was not secure. Ran a security test with Gibson Research and the HTTP was wide open and unsecured. Will keep trying but I followed the instructions to get a secure connection while at a hotel.
customer_reviews.author: sleddogs

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I have been extremely impressed with how my hootoo has worked. I work outside with secured networks testing operations of equipment and it reaches distances I wouldn’t of thought. I go from site to site however and unplug and plugin my Ethernet cord, always carful not to tug it out. The reason for only 4 stars is I had this for a little over 6 months and the little tabs inside holding the Ethernet connecter have fallen out. Now I can’t get a connecting without taping the Ethernet to the right spot. I still recommend this my coworkers which several have gotten, use daily and love.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome battery life, good signal
customer_reviews.text: Bought on the recommendation of several co-workers. I've been using it will over 1 year now, primarily as a travel router during extremely long flights. Continuous use with 2 to 3 devices connect it will keep operating for over 20 hours. Strongly recommend downloading and READing the user manual if you are planning to use for multiple purposes. Of course, its a great portable battery for charging your small devices, too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as intended
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a good idea to extend wifi among other passengers on our cruise. Didn't work as intended. Worked well in the hotel with a simple numeric password, but on the cruise using a two step (cruisers name and password) didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: IFISHAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great little on the go device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work and for trips. Setup is easy if you are familiar with basic router setup. I use this to help remotely program alarm panels using wifi so I dont need to directly plug my laptop into the panel. Ita a wonderful gadget with good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeLife

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent peace of Technology!. The device works as a portable charger and a file sharing hub which supports even external hard drives. It can also be used as a(n) wifi extender. The app is really great and simple to use, just remember to restart the device if you ever make some changes to the password or device name.
customer_reviews.author: HAMG

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and stops working
customer_reviews.text: Used it a couple times. Overheated and stopped working a couple times. Now it won’t power on at all. I have another one of their products, and that one is wonderful, this one needs more work.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jax

customer_reviews.title: Device will not work, the issue will not be fixed by support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a cruise. The device was not able to work at all. It will crash and restart every couple of minutes so basically it will be useless I also updated the firmware and it did not fix it. The only way to get this to work was to reset to factory defaults and then it will work for 5-10 minutes till it fails again.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a looong car ride with 3 kids and their iPad's. They were able to stream content off of a USB stick I plugged into HooToo. It worked like a charm! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible network config.
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of box. Using it a a media in 2018 Honda Odyssey. Casts media from my 4TB exfat drive to the Honda RES via Chromecast or DLNA. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: John Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Went on a family cruise with 20 family members and purchased this prior to the trip so that visitors to our room had wifi and we could share with my spouse and children. This was a hit, and worked flawlessly. It had great wifi signal. Highly recommend if going on a cruise or just want to share a single wifi signal with multiple users. Did not use outside of our room but would expect that it would have worked without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lalani

customer_reviews.title: Finally an easy way to share content while off-grid
customer_reviews.text: I only use this to create a WiFi network while I am camping or hunting. Finally an easy way to share content while off-grid. I am only using android devices to access the thumb drive I mounted. For some reason it does have problems streaming certain content but that’s not required for my needs. It could be a littler faster but its reliable and self-contained. Pretty handy when you are off-grid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up. And works very well for streaming.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy happy happy. My Wi-Fi is horrible at my job so I bought a Ravpower what a complete and utter disappointment it did not work. So I bought my TripMate. Major difference. It works so well easy to set up easy to store. Most excellent item. Thank you thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my purpose. I'm using it to control my Canon 6D camera from my phone. I just had to turn off the logon password so my camera can connect. Since I'm not connected to the internet (just phone to camera) it doesn't matter that anyone else could connect. Love it. Great for camera control in the wild.
customer_reviews.author: Techie One

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program
customer_reviews.text: Its exactly what it says it is. Easy to program. I use it with a Raspberry pi to make a closed network audio server. This guy will also save you cash at hotels that charge by the amount of connecting devices. It also will give you some extra security with a firewall.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little router
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a pocket-sized router/NAS/charger, this little guy fits the bill! It comes nicely packaged, looks great, feels substantial, easy to set up, and works like a charm. I connect this to a Netgear LB2120 4G/LTE modem which is set up on my AT&T unlimited data plan, and I have a fully portable modem/router combo that can give me high-speed internet as long as I have a decent 4G/LTE signal. Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.author: Mark McDaneld

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: The functionality of this battery pack is great! I love the charge that it holds so that I can keep my phone charged up all day. The travel router is a great addition. Unlike what people think, it is not a personal hotspot. However, it can act as a router when an ethernet cable is plugged in and such! Love this router/battery pack!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I love this little router
customer_reviews.text: I love this little router. lets me set up my own wifi network off of any wired network, it lets me extend my existing network and the battery feature keeps this little guy powered for days. Not to mention you can charge a phone from it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Update: After receiving a defective device they agree to change it for a new one, the new HooToo device is working perfectly, thanks guys for being so nice. 12Feb2020 update: HOOTTO Still in good conditions and working as it should, great quality. Do not have a stable connection, even for small archives as pictures or songs disconnects a lot.
customer_reviews.author: David Jacobo

customer_reviews.title: Good battery, slow wifi speeds. Exceptional customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product overall. There are issues with the bridge mode. Speeds are slow , I have 100mbps fiber optic line, i get between 80-122 mbps up and down with 3ms ping. I tested it wired(only 30 mbps download) and bridge mode(22mbps) there seems to be something wrong or limitations on the wifi chip. Updated 9/2/2018. Customer service reached out to me to rectify the issue, they sent another unit for me to test out and I still stand with my review. Thank you Miezi for your support.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel R.

customer_reviews.title: RV Park wifi repeater.
customer_reviews.text: Great repeater. I put the hootoo where the rv park public wifi is strong. Then I can pick up the signal elsewhere in the 5th wheel on multiple devices.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: Great innovative product!
customer_reviews.text: Great USB charger for phones and tablets. Also worked great as a wifi router and bridge. Will recommend to friends that travel.
customer_reviews.author: Balot

customer_reviews.title: No 5G - dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Only compatible with 2GHz networks which is unacceptable in this day and age. Don't waste your money. Buy a different router with 5G support.
customer_reviews.author: utche96

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works with sites that Apple won't allow!
customer_reviews.text: Just had my first chance to use this and it worked *great*. Hotel wifi, wasn't able to connect with my Mac but the HooToo connected fine and got me connectivity without any hassles, both with the mac and the phone. Easy setup, just what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Becoming a HooToo fan!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HooToo product I've purchased. Decided to upgrade to this device since it had a bigger battery. Traveling with this router makes life easier and saves money if you have to purchase internet. Have used this on flights and shared out my connection with family.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose device!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this thing for a 14 hour car trip, and all three of my kids were able to watch their own show/movie on their own device, and It was on battery power the whole way (one way - I charged it between trips.)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I was planning to use this product mainly to bridge wifi connections and it utterly fails at that. After a random couple of minutes, the device's wifi connection to the internet will randomly drop and then nothing, I repeat, nothing but a hard reset will bring it back. I had a separate network device connected to the same wifi with completele reliability and great throughput at the same time. Device is a complete failure and waste of money, sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC COMBO
customer_reviews.text: ITEM ARRIVED ON TIME , I LOVE THAT I CAN USE THIS TO CHARGE MY PHONE AND AS A ROUTER. I WORK PART TIME IN A PHONE/COMPUTER STORE AND THERE IS NO WIFI, NOW I PLUG THIS IN AND MAKE MY OWN WIFI FOR WHEN I AM WORKING. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: coachice

customer_reviews.title: WiFi extender, portable nas, portable router, portable charger.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is like the swiss army knife of routers. Works well, i use in conjunction with 20,000 mah power pack gets me 3-5 days use. I do need to factory reset frequently as performance degrades overtime, tricky to update directions are not exactly correct to me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Egan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and portable
customer_reviews.text: I used the HooToo Wireless Traveler all day at the Arnold Palmer Invitation and it lasted all day. Wonderful and portable. Great use, I would recommend it as a portable charging device as well as a portable router and outlet.
customer_reviews.author: BroccoLe

customer_reviews.title: Generally an OK device
customer_reviews.text: I like most everything about the router/battery pack, except for the security issues. Locking down a router from external (WAN) access and configuration is not too hard. Although I know it won't be super secure, but it would at least close a somewhat obvious front door into your pseudo private network you are hanging off of someone else's Wifi/wired internet access. Do it, and I would consider this a 4-5 star purchase. VPN service would be a nice to have, and maybe an android/apple app to manage it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Network speeds not as quick as expected, battery works fine
customer_reviews.text: Network speeds were slower than expected, battery backup works well. on the other side of this purchase, I just didn't find this to be as useful as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: A. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, took about 5 minutes to get a mobile hotspot going. Seems to be in Bridge Mode by default. Can't find find any online documentation though. Maybe it's same as older model.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Kumar

customer_reviews.title: DLNA Compatible WIth IPAD and Roku
customer_reviews.text: Great way to serve up media for the kids. I have an original HooToo and bought this one since it also can recharge devices.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Graham

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says!
customer_reviews.text: Im using it as a wifi extender where i had an ethernet cord available but was too far away in my building to get a wifi signal from the router. Works perfectly, i now get a full wifi signal and my own little personal network!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: My house has cable modem internet. I don't use my computer all the time and needed "WiFi" for my parents when they visit. This was perfect! I have the RavPower (older model) and used it in the same capacity. I wanted a back up and this works awesome. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MackIndigoCody

customer_reviews.title: Takes some knowledge to get the most out of.
customer_reviews.text: Great for movies in the car, as long as you know how to download them to a flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rush

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a 15 day cruise with me, hoping that it would help me connect more than 1 device and I couldn't get it to work. I tried almost everyday and it would not connect to the ships internet. Would like to return. The date for returning has passed, but I was on the cruise when the date came up. Had I been home, I would have returned it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Rothe

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good performer
customer_reviews.text: Works great as both a battery pack and a travel router. I was surprised by how small it is, which makes it extraordinarily easy to bring it with you as while you travel. Instructions for the WiFi connection are a bit tedious, but they are detailed enough to follow without trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on airplane
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to avoid paying multiple wifi access while traveling with my family. It works perfectly and 5 people use this and we paid once. It works on battery!
customer_reviews.author: H.J.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable. Great combination of features.
customer_reviews.text: I love this router! Not as simple a setup as some have said, but after a few minutes I had it working. It arrived the day before I left on a trip and allowed me to complete setup in hotel where I was confident in using the hotel wifi. Don't need a separate battery backup.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Riverside

customer_reviews.title: Great little device.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. The ability to share files from a hard drive and convert a wired network access to WiFi has been invaluable. And the best of all is that it is extremely easy to set up. I have rarely used it to as a backup battery but it's a great added benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Hootoo waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The product is a pain to set up. Will just send it back and find a better product. The directions are awful and even YouTube is not very good for setup. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: This worked great to share our internet connection with everyone in our ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great to share our internet connection with everyone in our room aboard a cruise that we recently took. It was also portable, so we could take it around the ship as needed. Easy to setup and doubles as a charger.
customer_reviews.author: Stinger72

customer_reviews.title: Sets up easily and Siri’s like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for vacation. The condo has a wired Internet connection, but who wants to sit in one place? Setup was practically nothing, and I’m able to have Wi-Fi on two tablets and two phones and if I had more devices, it would handle a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeydid

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup/ great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item before a family vacation. Made the flight amazing had a usb stick full of movies and everyone in the family had their pick of what they wanted to watch. Got to the hotel and bridged with the hotel wifi with ease and had great connection speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, didn’t know how bad I really needed it until I started using it, not a bad price either.
customer_reviews.author: The BOSS

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Versatile. I travel frequently and rely of its versatility from hotspot to portable charger to media steaming.
customer_reviews.author: CFD

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awseome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It boosts my hotel signal by 90%
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Came on time. Looks & works well. Should last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Long Gone

customer_reviews.title: VERY FAST
customer_reviews.text: Multi used, and very fast! Used in conjunction with iOS lightning-to-ethernet cable, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for travel...very functional with WiFi and charging capability. Purchased to specifically go with travel WiFi devices I purchased. Look forward to giving it a try on my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: pmhdmh

customer_reviews.title: great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nifty portable charger, great for traveling! On my last trip, I was with a group of 6 people and it came in handy when we all wanted to use WiFi. Makes connecting so much easier and especially when you are in a hotel room with a limit on the number of devices that can connect directly to their network. This device makes it look like only one device is connected.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Pham

customer_reviews.title: It will not provide hotspot link to my current network ...
customer_reviews.text: It will not provide hotspot link to my current network. Kept providing error and saying cannot connect to network. I've watched countless videos on YouTube and the easiest way is to hardwire it to the modem which defeats the purpose of portability 😔 The older hootoo unit I bough that had a smaller battery was actually more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: D Leh

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a nano hub. But I guess I read it wrong. Is a great charger.
customer_reviews.author: CONNIE

customer_reviews.title: Great Option
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised. I used this to make available wifi storage instead of paying much more for wifi equipped disk drives. Great option.
customer_reviews.author: Shomang

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Now my streaming isn't slowed down by sharing ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it to convert hotel ethernet to wifi. Works great. Now my streaming isn't slowed down by sharing a wifi connection with all the other guests with 4 or 5 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Heloduck

customer_reviews.title: Sea to land
customer_reviews.text: Good for all. And on the land or sea.. easy wifi everywhere.. wahoo.
customer_reviews.author: D. T

customer_reviews.title: You need this on a cruise
customer_reviews.text: Was a great use during our cruise. A little difficult to set up but worked once done. Saved us on the WiFi package
customer_reviews.author: Tania Peterson Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Hi I have just received this item and I have found it easy to use and connect to my ipod and android tablet. I have to thank amazon for their support and the excellent delivery service I have not tried anything else yet. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a regular household router in a small apartment, so there are some features I haven't tried, but setting it up to convert a wired internet connection to wifi took only a few minutes and it seems to give me a pretty good connection. Overall, I'm quite satisfied with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Olivas

customer_reviews.title: So complicated
customer_reviews.text: We were never able to get this to work. We would return it but it is out of the window for returns. Too complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Handle little device , can be used to save money when traveling at places that make you may per device to connect to wifi (cruise ships and some hotels) ..Only thing this device does not support is wifi to Ethernet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Forbes

product_meta.title: HooToo Filehub, Wireless Travel Router, iPhone iPad Portable SSD Hard Drive Reader, Photo Backup Device, 10400mAh External Battery Pack Travel Charger - TripMate Titan
product_meta.description: New update for HooToo wireless travel router1) we have shut up Telnet and SSH on Feb 2015, fw-7620-wifidgrj-hootoo-ht-tm05-2. 000. 034. 2)the engineering team has updated our app and improve product quality for years, thanks for the advice from every customer to make this product more and more stable. 3)please feel free to email us if you have questions with our travel router series. what can Trip Mate TITAN do for you?1)be a wireless travel router instantly convert a wired network to wireless to create your own secure Wi-Fi network. 2)be a powerful file hub. trip mate TITAN transfers files between multiple USB hard drives and your devices (phone/tablet/computer) to free much more space up for your devices. It can support USB card reader, USD flash drive, HDD and so on which means you can use this USB hard drives to transfer your document/photos/videos between SD card, HDD, and your devices (phone/tablet/computer). you don't need to take your computer anymore when traveling. 3)be a power bank built-in 10400mAh power bank (5V/2. 1a) enables you to charge your iPhone or smartphone up to 3 times. Please use the latest app: HooToo Trip Mate Plus. Note: it cannot be compatible with affinity hot spot. trip mate is powerful, but: 1 ) cannot be used for IP camera FTP Path; 2 ) cannot work as a proxy server; do not support vpn3 ) The Ethernet port can only be used as a WAN input port; 4 ) no app for Windows phone OS; 5 ) It supports NTFS/FAT16/FAT32 formatted disk; 6 ) cannot bridge an iPhone hotspot. 7 ) cannot stream The media purchased from iTunes except DRM free medias due to digital rights Management policy. 8 ) Due to the limitation of the Apple iOS system, you can only access the photos folder on your iPad/iPhone; file hub is currently unstable to sync with media files stored in iTunes to USB storage devices due to digital rights Management (DRM). 9 ) Does not work with Mac formatted hard drive. 10）up to 5 mobile devices can connect simultaneously allowing you to stream media from the SD or USB drives, or you can directly share files between two different storage devices. 11）as a portable router, you can turn any wired network and make it wireless, or connect it via a DSL or cable modem and it will act as a regular router.
feature_bullets: Storage backup: This Trip Mate Titan transfers files between multiple USB hard drives and your devices (phone/tablet/computer) to free much more space up for your devices.
Wireless router: instantly convert a wired network to wireless network. And bridge and extend Wi-Fi, share internet securely with others (but it's not a hotspot and do not support VPN).

Media Streamer & Sharer: seamlessly share with your families, friends and stream your videos, photos, and music on your connected smartphones, tablets, TVs, media players, Chromecast, Roku, and other DLNA devices, via app HooToo Trip Mate Plus.
New USB reader technology: wirelessly recognize USB Flash Drive, hard disk, SDHC, SDXC cards with your devices (phone/tablet/computer) via Trip Mate app, even more support with a USB hub.

Upgraded chip & external battery packs: built-in 10400mAh power bank (5V/2. 1a) enables you to charge your iPhone or smartphone up to 3 times. Please use the latest app: HooToo Trip Mate Plus. Note: it cannot be compatible with hot spot.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars446 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
